name: Consume

route.userURI: Represents the user identity in the following format: 'id:<userid>' or 'msisdn:<number>'.

requestBody.description: Parameters format depends on the application domain and operation.

responseBody.description: The ID given by the billing system when a purchase is done.
The given ID of a purchase when it is done.
Specifies whether the purchase is done. True if a purchase is done, else False.
The ID for the recurrent purchase given that one has been purchased.
Status code for the operation. 0 for success (see error code table otherwise).
Specifies whether the ticket is unlimited to be used. True if the ticket is unlimited to be used, else False.
Specifies whether the ticket is consumed. True if the ticket is consumed, else False.

Parameters.description: Properties used for product and price selection (list of meta).
Meta data stored together with the used ticket (list of meta).

billingErrorInformation.description: Error code that indicates the billing error.
The accompanying message description for the error code.
Additional information returned from external charging system.

name: Get User Purchases

route.userURI: Represents the user identity in the following format: 'id:<userid>' or 'msisdn:<number>'.

requestBody.description: Parameters format depends on the application domain and operation.

responseBody.description: The purchase ID that is given when a purchase is done.

The purchase type. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- NORMAL
- GIFT_PURCHASE
- GIFT

The purchase state. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- OPEN
- OFFERED
- CLOSED
The ID of the recurrent purchase. If the purchase is a recurrent purchase then it has a value, otherwise it is empty.
The time when the recurrent purchase is expired.
The time when the recurrent purchase is canceled.
The time when the recurrence is expired.
Total allowed renewal times of the current product.

Parameters.description: Indicates the page that will be searched.
The search condition to be filtered.

paginationRequest.description: The maximum items for a search. For example, if fromItem is set to 5 for index number and maxItems is set to 10 for maximum number of items, the searched record will be from numbers 5 to 15. The maximum value of maxItems is 50 by default (System configuration).

sortItem.description:
The sorted field. The search results will be ordered in this field. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- created
- serviceId
- productId
- providerId
- type
- state

The sorted order. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- asc: The result is shown in ascending order.
- desc: The result is shown in descending order.

filter.description: The purchase ID is used for search criteria.
The start time value indicates the time period for a search. The records of which the created time is later than the time set in start element are returned.
The end time value indicates the time period for a search. The records of which the created time is earlier than the time set in end element are returned.

The purchase type. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- NORMAL
- GIFT_PURCHASE
- GIFT

The purchase state. It is an enumeration type and defined as follows:
- OPEN
- OFFERED
- CLOSED

name: Purchase

route.userURI: Represents the user identity in the following format: 'id:<userid>' or 'msisdn:<number>'.

requestBody.description: Parameters format depends on the application domain and operation.

responseBody.description: The ID given by the billing system when a purchase is done.
The given ID of a purchase when it is done.
Specifies whether the purchase is done. True if a purchase is done, else False.
The ID for the recurrent purchase given that one has been purchased.
Status code for the operation. 0 for success (see error code table otherwise).
Specifies whether the ticket is unlimited to be used. True if the ticket is unlimited to be used, else False.
Specifies whether the ticket is consumed. True if the ticket is consumed, else False.

Parameters.description: The sub distribution list of the purchase if the purchase is related to a messaging service with sub distribution list. It is a string.
Properties used for product and price selection (list of meta).
Meta data that is stored if a purchase is done (list of meta).

Meta data passed to the billing implementation. The charging operation in ParlayX payment interface is configurable by setting the value of billing-meta:doChargeFlag key. If the value is set to true, the chargeAmount method in the ParlayX payment interface is used. If the value is set to false, the reserveAmount and chargeReservation methods in  ParlayX payment interface are used.

billingErrorInformation.description: Error code that indicates the billing error.
The accompanying message description for the error code.
Additional information returned from external charging system.

name: Get Products

route.userURI: Represents the user identity in the following format: 'id:<userid>' or 'msisdn:<number>'.

requestBody.description: Parameters format depends on the application domain and operation.

responseBody.description: True if the product is enabled, else false.
Specifies whether the ticket is unlimited to be used. True if the ticket is unlimited to be used, else False.
The price quotes for the product.
True if recurrent purchase is enabled.
The time when the recurrence is expired.
Total allowed renewal times of the current product.
The interval for the recurrent purchase.

The unit for the recurrent purchase interval. The applicable values are as follows:
- DAY
- MONTH
The trial interval for the recurrent purchase.

The unit for the recurrent purchase trial interval. The applicable values are as follows:
- DAY
- MONTH

The unit type of recurrent purchase. The applicable values are as follows:
- DAY
- MONTH

Tickets.description: The number of total usages in the defined ticket.
The maximum number of usages in the defined ticket.

The ticket type. The applicable types are as follows:
- NORMAL
- COMPENSATION
- GIFT
The time when the recurrent purchase is expired.
The time when the recurrent purchase is cancelled.

Indicates whether the ticket can be unlimitedly used. The following values can be set:
- True: The ticket can be used unlimitedly in a certain time period. Usually it is a subscription type, that is, unlimited usage during one month.
- False: The ticket can be used limitedly in a certain times. Usually it is a standard ticket on which you pay a certain amount and can use it at certain times. For example, pay $5.00 and use 10 times.

name: Sign Up
description: Client application can use this API to generate a one-time password and trigger an email to vehicle operator.

resourceTable.API Key: Application-specific API Key. The key can be provided as part of application on-boarding to ASDP.

name: Check Request Status
description: Remote services application can use this API to check the status of a given request (success or failure).

resourceTable.API Key: Application-specific API Key. The key can be provided as part of application on-boarding to ASDP.

route.requestId: An identifier previously sent in the response body of a remote service request

responseBody.description: Status of previously sent request. Possible values: success, failed, queued.
Remote service request name. Possible values: Door Unlock, Door Lock, Engine On, Engine Off, Honk Blink, Diagnostics.
Diagnostic data returned when diagnostic request is sent.

name: View Diagnostic Data
description:
Remote services application can use this API to retrieve diagnostic data from TCU.
Some markets may have vehicle proximity regulations that make device coordinates parameters mandatory.

resourceTable.API Key: Application-specific API Key. The key can be provided as part of application on-boarding to ASDP.

requestBody.description: Latitude of device running remote services application.
Longitude of device running remote services application.

responseBody.description: Request identifier to query request status

responseBody.description: Request identifier to query request status

name: Get Message
description: This API is called by TCU to get message details (remote operation).

route.messageId: Represents the message identifier previously sent in a should tap message from dispatcher to TCU

responseBody.description: Request identifier to query request status
1: door unlock, 2: door lock, 3: engineOn, 4: engineOff, 5: honkBlink, 6: diagnostics, 7: resetTroubleCodes, 8:status

name: Send Message
description: This API is called by TCU to send a message to dispatcher.

route.messageId: Represents the message identifier previously sent in a should tap message from dispatcher to TU or message newly created by TU. In case messageId is not provided, Send Message API shall check if there a pending request for that VIN that matches the serviceId in which case the response is sent back otherwise telematics data is simply stored in M2M DM.

requestBody.description: Request identifier to query request status
1: door unlock, 2: door lock, 3: engineOn, 4: engineOff, 5: honkBlink, 6: diagnostics, 7: resetTroubleCodes, 8:status
Status is a 2 bytes code containing error code: Zero being the success code and any other value an error code
Diagnostic data and trouble codes in a json format (key: value).

name: TCU Shoulder Tap
description:
Shoulder tap is an SMS message that shall be sent from dispatcher to notify TCU of service request.
Since the TCU simulator does not have SMS capabilities, the SMS shall be replaced by an HTTP call.
This API shall be implemented on the TCU (not on the dispatcher).

requestBody.description: Request identifier to query request status

name: Ping TCU
description: This is a health check call to make sure TCU simulator is up.

name: TCU Notification Channel
description: This API is called by TCUs that do not support SMS or HTTP. ASDP will maintain an open HTTP channel (when longpoll is set to true) with TCU to get message notifications. If longpoll parameter is not specified or set to false, the response shall be returned immediately (with empty body: no json response).

responseBody.description: A list of request identifiers to query request status

description: Return list of registered vehicles.

Query string in Lucene format. '*' wildcard supported. E.g., 
owner: 12fd3e34fd3412
vehicle:1TX123456789011223
year:2014 AND status:demo
The number to start the querying
List of items to be sorted

Vehicle condition. For instance Excellent, Good, Poor, Unknown.

Specifies the order that the items will be sorted.
If the value is set to true, the items are sorted in the descending order.
If the value is set to false, the items are sorted in the ascending order.
